Class Date

java.lang.Object
com.example.project3.util.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
The Date enum class has the information to provide the day, month, and year of a transaction. For the months of January, March, May, July, August, October, and December, each has 31 days; April, June, September, and November each has 30 days; February has 28 days in a non-leap year, and 29 days in a leap year; Quadrennial is 4 years, centennial is 100 years, and quarter centennial is 400 years.

    • Date

      public Date()
      Creates a Date object initialized with the current date. This constructor retrieves the current date using the `Calendar` class.

    • isEighteen

      public boolean isEighteen()
      Checks if the Account holder is 18 years or older. Uses the Calendar library to import the actual date for calculations. Note: Month is 0-based in Calendar.
      Returns:
      true if the account holder is 18 years or older false otherwise

    • isOverTwentyFour

      public boolean isOverTwentyFour()
      Checks if the date represents someone who is over 24 years of age.
      Returns:
      true if the individual is over 24 years old, false otherwise

    • addMonths

      public Date addMonths(int monthsToAdd)
      Adds the specified number of months to the current date and returns a new Date object representing the updated date. The method accounts for month and year rollovers.
      Parameters:
      monthsToAdd - the number of months to add to the current date
      Returns:
      a new Date object representing the updated date after adding the specified number of months

    • isAfter

      public boolean isAfter(Date other)
      Compares this date with another date to determine if this date occurs after the provided date.
      Parameters:
      other - the date to compare with this date
      Returns:
      true if this date occurs after the provided date, false otherwise

    • isAfterToday

      public boolean isAfterToday()
      Checks if the birthdate comes after today's date.
      Returns:
      true if birthdate comes after today's date false otherwise

    • isLeapYear

      public boolean isLeapYear()
      Checks if the year provided is a leap year. Every 4 years, 100 years, and 400 years is a leap year.
      Returns:
      true if the year is a leap year false otherwise

    • daysFrom

      public int daysFrom(Date other)
      Calculates the number of days from the given date to the current date.
      Parameters:
      other - the Date object to compare with the current date
      Returns:
      the number of days from the specified date to the current one

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date other)
      Compares this Date to another Date.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      other - Date being compared with
      Returns:
      0 if dates are equal -1 if first date comes before the second 1 if first date comes after the second
